Do you like shooting zombies? Do you like preposterously British accents? Do you like LOADSAMONAY? Then give Killing Floor a try.
Probably one of the best horror FPS I have played.

Killing Floor is a very unique zombie survival game.  In this 6-player co-op shooter, you must fend off wave after wave of nasty looking zeds, or you'll all be eaten alive.  The number of threats increase after you clear each wave, as well as presenting new, horrifying creatures over time.  After clearing a wave, you and your teammates must locate the Trader who opens up shop in various areas across each map to stock up on ammo, repair armor, and even purchase new weapons that'll come in handy later on.  After every wave has been cleared, players will be forced to face the Patriarch, the boss (or father of the zeds, as he claims) at the end of each game.  Not only is he the largest creature of them all, but can sprint at an incredible speed, attacking any player in his path.  In addition to chasing your team across the map, he has a machine gun for an arm to attack at great distances, as well as a rocket launcher to deal devastating blows if you aren't too careful.  Players will need to work together to face these challenges and come out alive.

I highly recommend this to people who just enjoy violent, gore-heavy zombie shooters.
TIITIIIISSS!!!! (  .  Y  .  )
Great fun for you and your friends. Better than L4D in my opinion especially considering it didn't have the same amount of funding.

I had done a short/quick review on this a while back, but now with the introduction of the steam reviews system, I figured I might as well take the time and do a proper review for this game.  

Killing Floor is by far my most played steam game, and was the entire reasoning for me getting a steam account in the first place.  A friend sent me the "guest pass" for Killing Floor and had me try it out, and then ended up gifting me it for $5 when I enjoyed it.  I first got Killing Floor in August of 2009, so 4 years later and I still play this game daily pretty much.  The replay value is through the roof, not to mention if you buy it on one of the frequent sales (I've seen Killing Floor more than 50% off at least TEN times in the year 2013 so far) will put it under $10 USD.  DLCs might have become a little pricey over the past few years, but the fact that Tripwire Interactive still does free content updates for this game nearly FIVE YEARS post release is simple mind blowing.  I don't know of any other company that continues support for it's product that long into the future.  The few companies that continually support releases that I can think of have all produced sequels to those games.

Now to get down to gameplay.  Killing Floor first and foremost is a FPS game.  There are a variety of different types of guns, spread around in 7 different perks or classes.  These perks have a "progression system" that allows a player to get more "profficient" with the weapons of their classes and earn more "bonuses" such as being able to carry more ammo, do more damage, and other things of that nature.  Each perk has a different role which helps a team in it's own unique way.  Like making things blow up, then Demolitions is the perk for you with it's LAW, M32 multiple grenade launcher, m79, and others..  Like setting things on fire and feeding the inner pyromaniac in yourself?  Then firebug is the perk for you with it's flamethrower, flare revolvers, Husk fireball launcher, and other guns with incendiary ammo.  Enjoy the satisfying feeling of blowing an enemies head off?  Then pick the sharpshooter perk, with it's assortment of pistols, sniper rifle, compound crossbow, or various rifles.  Killing Floor has the most satisfying gun play of any game I've ever played.  Excellent feel to the weapons, and they look and sound great.  

When it comes to enemies, there are 10 different types of enemies to deal with.  Each one of the "zeds" are similar in some ways, but different in most.  There are the basic enemies, such as the clot, which can grab any perk aside from the beserkser.  Clots don't do all that much damage, but they can make you not able to move and allow the other, more dangerous enemies to get to you and do more damage.  Then you get to the more specialised enemies such as stalkers, which can go invisible, bloats, which puke "bile" on you which can hurt you and ruin your body armor, to sirens, whose screams can shatter glass, destroy rockets, grenades and explosives, break down the welds of doors, and eventually make your head explode, to the husk, resistant to fire attacks (for the most part) who can melee you when up close but is much more dangerous at distance where they can shoot fireballs at you. The more advanced of the enemies are the Scrake, which is a high health enemy with a chainsaw that if it gets close to you, it will start to saw away at your health.  If you are getting attacked by a scrake, don't run, because their full swings and charging attacks do exponentially more damage to you.  Scrakes are best left to sharpshooters which can stun it, berserkers which can do the same thing, or support specialists that know advanced "Techniques" to deal iwth them,Next you have the Fleshpound, which is a big, hulking enemy with high health and hard to kill.  High head damage resistance make it so it shrugs off weaker weapons.  Sharpshooters with good aim and fast reflexes can take them out in a number of ways, but can really only do so one at a time.  Support specialists get explosives bonuses, which make it a good choice to take out fleshpounds (unless there is a siren nearby).  Demolotions is the most polished perk to take down Fleshpounds, as they have a weakness to explosives.  

After you finish the "waves" of enemies, you then have to prepare to fight the boss of Killing Floor, the Patriarch.  The patriarch has some vicious melee attacks, and also has an arm with a rocketlauncher/chain gun combination that can and will kill you quick. Defeating the patrairch requires good teamwork and communication generally.

Lastly, but not least, is the fact that Killing Floor comes with a free to download SDK system that allows for modding of the game and creation of custom content.  This also comes with a community workshop area dedicated solely to Killing Floor.  So check out the steam workshop and try out some of the amazing modded content there is to offer.
If you like Left 4 Dead, you'll like this.
Jogo viciante! Recomendo a todos testarem!

Ever pondered how the murderous apocalypse so often seen in fiction would go in Britain? Do you enjoy reloading your weapon in the middle of bloody combat with waves after waves of suicidal clones attack you while your teammates are busy keeping a key door welded? Harry Enfield's Loadsamonay is your favourite piece of Youtube entertainment, period? 

Look no further! Tripwire's Killing Floor is a working piece of moddage on top of Unreal Engine which gives you and a few mates half a dozen perks ("Classes") and a few dozen weapons to select from, with which to shoot, mangle, chop or turn your clone army foes into giblets with during 4 to 10 round games. Got all maps completed on Normal in solo mode and Support leveled up to level 3? Please, you'll get eaten on Hard, so get your perks leveled and your friends' as well! RYYL BRTISH YXNT included!

An awesome hoard shooter in the same genre as Left 4 dead.

But in this game you have a very diverse set of monsters (called specimens) that are out to kick your ass.

Lucky for you have perks that enable you to kick their ass.

Very fun to play with friends.

I found this game to be more enjoyable than Left 4 Dead.  In this game, you must group up with your teammates to survive increasingly dangerous waves of zeds. There are more weapons to choose from than Left 4 Dead and it also has classes that you can choose from which you must level up to gain bonuses to class specific weapons.  The group play is solid as well.  You and your team must choose a spot on the map to make your stand.  You need to stay grouped up to survive the waves of zeds that will come for your flesh as there are simply too many zeds to deal with alone, especially in later waves.  Different classes will have weapons that can take out certain zed types more quickly and efficiently than other classes, which makes it more important to stick with your buddies and to put together a group of varying classes than can handle any situation.  A very good game if you love killing zombies.
Wop ya wallet, wop ya wallet, wop ya wallet on the counta!
Ei huono ostos.
sehr schönes Game!

Choose from 7 different perks and level up by killing zeds with specific guns, or melee weapons, or by just keeping your team healthy by healing them. Tons of maps, achievements, and up to 6 players in a game. There are many different types of zeds to kill, and the game developers update the game every couple months or so with new characters to choose from and different looking zeds. Also this game tracks stats ongoing even after you have reached the highest level for each perk.  This game has an obscene amount of replayable value. It goes on sale for a bargain of only 5 dollars as well.
This is a very good experience, killing zombies and having fun with your friends it's just Great, free events, maps even guns sometimes, no matter how long you play it, never gets old!

Killing Floor is by far one of the best co-op games one can have. The game focuses on complimentary classes that a team can divid themselves into to fit each players' playstyle. The enemies are unique and the game feels very gritty but also is quite funny do to the british characters yelling. I'd recommend this game for anyone who is a fan of survival games.

Killing Floor is one of those casual zombie shooters that give you a cheap scare every now and again. There are waves of barely intelligent specimens (zombie like characters), a group of 6 players and a bunch of different weapons with 6 character classes that have their own unique perks. It delivers to you plenty of fun hours for a very cheap price tag.

Cheap, fun and easy to play. My suggestion is pick it up and get a few friends to as well, it's a great game.

If you like Left 4 Dead then by all means get this game.  Even if you don't, try it.  You and the people you play with essentially must survive proceedingly tougher waves of zombie/mutants.  Teamwork is a must, as it becomes easy to get swarmed, so don't play it if you like to Rambo things by yourself.

Excellent Game! Plenty of maps to try out, most of which are somewhat large. Lots of cool weapons, and plenty of different types of Zeds to hunt. Plenty of different classes to play as. I like the diversity of this one. It's kind of hard to get bored with so many variables to choose from. My friends that do have this enjoy it as well, we have a blast playing.  KF offers me a nice change of pace in a similar vein to L4D/2. If you've got the extra cash go for the bundle and get a mess of playable characters. Gore, violence, and hilarious fun....Good times...

The best way to play this game, is to grab yer mates and weld youselves inside a public restroom.

Killing Floor is a FPS game that's mostly only enjoyable when you have a handful of friends to play with. (Yeah thanks for nagging me to get it and never play with me guys!!)

In a nutshell, you and your friends arm yourself with weapons of your choice like the shotgun, a grenade launcher, machine gun, or even a rocket launcher. You and your team need to fight off monstrous creatures that are often argued to being either mutant clones or zombies.

Anyway if you can get a group of friends (Real friends, not random people) it's a great game, if your unable to you at least have Solo Mode to play, which becomes really boring quickly...
A most rewarding co-op shooter. Work together or die alone!
One of the few games that I just keep going back to again and again its just a really fun game solo or coop

Also mir hat Kf defintiv mehr fun gemacht als z.b. Прекрасный зомби кооп шутер, отличается четко выраженными классами игроков и прокачкой этих классов. Разнообразными картами и постоянными эвентами типа рождественской и летней тематики, что уж говорить одна из карт - это лаборатория Aperture Science. Очень слаженная игра: если ты один - значит ты труп !
